        cancelled - indicates whether or not the Request was cancelled.

      • onRequestSuccess

        public void onRequestSuccess(int id,
                    Response res)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: RequestCallbacks
        Called when the Request finishes with a 2xx status code.
        Specified by:
        onRequestSuccess in interface RequestCallbacks
        Parameters:
        id - the id given to the RequestHandler handling the Request.
        res - the Response the completed successfully.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an Exception that will be sent to onReuestException().

      • onRequestException

        public boolean onRequestException(int id,
                         Response res)
        Description copied from interface: RequestCallbacks
        Called when the Request finished with a non 2xx status code or when another Exception was caught while executing the Request. Response.hasException() is guaranteed to return true and Response.getException() return a non-null value.
        Specified by:
        onRequestException in interface RequestCallbacks
        Parameters:
        id - the id given to the RequestHandler handling the Request.
        Returns:
        true to indicate ex requires further processing by the RequestHandler's ExceptionHandler, false if not.

      • onRequestFinally

        public void onRequestFinally(int id,
                    boolean cancelled)
        Description copied from interface: RequestCallbacks
        Called regardless of success or failure (Exception caught) when the Request completes and after call(s) to onRequestSuccess() and onRequestException() return.
        Specified by:
        onRequestFinally in interface RequestCallbacks
        Parameters:
        id - the id given to the RequestHandler handling the Request.
        cancelled - indicates whether or not the Request was cancelled.
